title: Little Mix cancel Australia and New Zealand tour dates for second time
text:
Little Mix won X Factor in 2011 (Picture: Getty)

Little Mix has cancelled their upcoming Australia and New Zealand tour dates for a second time.

The band took to Twitter to share the news, writing: ‘We are really sad to announce we have to cancel upcoming Australia and New Zealand tour dates.

‘We are so sorry for disappoint our fans who ar coming to the shows. This is not a decision we have taken lightly but we have to use this time to focus on recording new music.

‘Please contact your point of purchase for a full refund on tickets.’

The tour dates were rearranged from June when the girls cancelled the original dates due to promotion for their single Bounce Back.

They were due to perform in Perth on 7 December, followed by Adelaide on 10 December, Melbourne on 13 December, before heading to Sydney on 14 December and finishing in Brisbane on 16 December.

The decision comes after the girls confirmed they are set to launch their own BBC talent show to compete with Simon Cowell’s The X Factor.

The girl band, consisting of Perrie Edwards, Leigh-Anne Pinnock, Jesy Nelson and Jade Thirwall, will be creating bands (all-female, all-male and mixed) from their hopefuls who think they have what it takes to follow in their footsteps.

The seven-part series will see the group mentor the young stars as they all live together, giving them access to their top-tier background team including vocal coaches, song writers and stylists.

Whoever wins will go on tour with the band as their warm-up act next year.

Basically, say goodbye to heading out on Saturday nights, Mixers – they’ve got you sorted.

description: Little Mix confirmed the cancelled tour dates on Twitter.
